metadata.name: The end of my bloody story
metadata.description:
This picture is dedicated to me. At the moment I started painting it, I was depressed. The disease was disfiguring me, my face, my body, and I couldn't do anything about it.

So I decided to take my pain out into art. ðŸ’€

The red tentacles symbolize the monster bursting out through the black cracks in my body. My eyes are covered with a veil of fear, I see nothing but the plague.ðŸ¥€

By the time I finish the painting, I have healed myself. That's why there's a flower growing out of my chest in the center, as a symbol of transformation and a happy ending to the story. ðŸŒº

But it was this deep state that allowed me to see the real me. There, inside, without clothes, name, body, face. Without judgment of myself or criticism.

I found the very same Lida. I had known her before she was born, she was a light and sweet ray of light to the point of insanity. That Lida was always smiling, even in the worst situations.

I got to know the real me. A being present be
